title: Trump 2020: Election News, Polls for President, Fundraising, Campaign, Opponents, Results & More - POLITICO
content:
By NOLAN D. MCCASKILL 04/10/2019 11:59 AM EDT
Julián Castro hasn’t released his first-quarter fundraising numbers. He’s polling around 1 percent nationally and in early states. But he has a unique opportunity for a presidential primary breakout moment Wednesday, when he’ll hold a rally in his San Antonio hometown — the same day Donald Trump will be in Texas for fundraisers in Houston and San Antonio.
The split-screen moment worked wonders for former Rep. Beto O’Rourke (D-Texas) in February, when he staged a counter-rally to Trump’s own MAGA rally in El Paso. Aside from the national media coverage of the dueling events, O’Rourke received a windfall of attention from Democrats for raising the president’s ire — Trump derided him as “a young man who’s got very little going for himself except he’s got a great first name.”

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: Nicely written, but fundamentally flawed. Sexism is a huge problem, including in politics and government. But, with respect to the performance of Democratic primary candidates, the article confuses correlation with causation. Just because a voter’s favorite candidate is a male does not mean that he’s the favorite BECAUSE he’s a male or because the voter thinks others aren’t ready for a female. That’s not giving voters nearly enough credit and feeds the antipathy toward condescension that causes democrats to lose despite their policies often being the most advantageous to the voters at issue. And, no, the fact that extremist Trump supporters chanted “lock her up,” does not evidence any problem “unique to women”! Those extremists also simultaneously and erroneously want to “lock up” (and chant as much) a material subset of the white MALES in the FBI and the “deep state” solely for having the audacity even to deign to investigate foreign electoral meddling and their tyrannical demagogue’s connections. Further, the notion that a material population supports the first openly gay major party candidate due to their misogyny and sexism — as opposed to being due to his policies, beliefs and historic role — is, well, to use the author’s allegation in the article’s title, just stupid. It’s frustrating and wrong for women to be forced to face sexist attitudes and misconduct; perpetrators of discrimination and traffickers in chauvinism should be held to account. But, like any other single lens to look at life through at the exclusion of others, it is a form of blinder that distorts important realities, including those associated with this election.

If Michelle were running, I'm certain she would be the current frontrunner. Overall, an unconvincing argument, especially to someone like me who held his nose and voted Hillary in the general (in 2016, not 2012.)

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: I do wish that, with such issues as this, the word "misogyny" would be left out. Misogyny is the hatred of women, and there are some who are truly like that but there are likely psychological issues involved. Sexism is a legitimate word to use for there are likely many who do not hate women but do no think they are "built" for executive leadership. And there may be a statistical slant in that direction for it seems that throughout history women have been noted more for nurturing leadership than the more aggressive leadership most people associate with the presidency. But, in the last election, I did not vote for Trump or any of the men in the primaries for they embarrassed me with their childishness or did not seem to have executive personality (e.g. the pediatric surgeon). I voted for Fiorina, the only one who acted like a grown-up. I have no aversion to female leaders. What I did notice is that in the one or two primary debates that I saw, THE PRESS virtually ignored Fiorina. Maybe they should have ignored Trump. Instead, they virtually handed him the presidency. Of course, virtually all the press was in the bag for Clinton and they could not allow for another woman to be taken seriously.

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: What about the media's role in hyping male candidates while continuing to review female candidates as a sidebar or in some other context? It's not about likeability. It's not about how pretty they are or what kind of haircut they have, what their arms look like in a sleeveless dress, or whether or not they are wearing designer outfits. It's about ABILITY. It's about quality. It's about their proposals, their goals, their voting records. It should be about their intelligence. Let's face it - when a man gets up on a podium the media never comments about how he looks, how his tone is "off-putting" or speculates about his stamina. He can say the most outrageous things, indulge in lies and explicit name calling, rant and whine and the media will cover his every word and every move and they'll opine endlessly - giving him loads and loads of media coverage on a daily basis. You don't see the media giving the women anywhere near that kind of coverage. If the media won't step up, the voters start believing their only choices are the male buffoons who waste billions of dollars sniping at each other.

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: Time to intrude on feminist storytime [not unlike climate denier storytime, except on the left rather than the right...] with human anthropological history. 1) Eggs are scarce. 2) Sperm is abundant. 3) Human females have therefore been selective with whom they mate, leading to far less than 1/2 of men having reproduced in human history, while more than 1/2 of women have. 4) This has produced an asymmetry in the distribution of traits in males relative to females, with males having much more variation, and females being much more uniform. 5) This results in the group of males having 2 sigma above standard deviation leadership traits being yet "better" than the equivalent group of females. Still, the Louie Gohmerts need to go. That does not mean that it's easy to find a woman who could beat Barack Obama one-on-one.

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: I'm down to vote for a woman if she runs on policies I agree with and expresses a political philosophy I can identify with. In fact the most impressive Democrat candidate I've seen so far has been Tulsi Gabbard followed closely by Andrew Yang. I know neither are likely to get the actual nomination but they're the only two I'd consider voting for over Trump in 2020.

title: It’s the Sexism, Stupid Magazine
content: "Two white male presidential candidates—Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders—have led the Democratic field from the start, and two others—Beto O’Rourke and Pete Buttigieg—have basked in glowing coverage. Meanwhile, experienced female rivals—Kirsten Gillibrand, Kamala Harris, Amy Klobuchar and Elizabeth Warren—haven’t generated nearly the same media buzz, or led any recent polls. What’s going on here? The evidence is mounting that these patterns are the work of sexism and misogyny—albeit often unconscious, unwitting and the result of implicit bias." No Kate. Kirsten Gillibrand, Kamala Harris, Amy Klobuchar and Elizabeth Warren are TERRIBLE CANDIDATES Truly. Does that mean Biden and Sanders are good candidates? No. It means they're marginally better against Trump than any of the female candidates. Beto and Buttigieg are even better. Booker and Castro and Yang are EVEN BETTER. This kvetching about misogyny is ridiculous and counterproductive. If you want to lose to prove a point, 2016 is calling and the blood of every single migrant who died in fucking CONCENTRATION CAMPSon the border is on your hands. If women want to win, they should try playing the game, not assuming we are all going to kiss their Jimmy Choos because they have two X chromosomes. Misogyny (as well as racism, xenophobia, and sheer unmitigated hate) elected Trump. Feminism will not beat him as long as it is a bunch of whiny entitled girls who can't tie their fucking shoes expecting to run the free world because "it's her turn." Sit down, Kate. Let the grown ups work.
